__e: And then I reflected back on the man that was looking at and talking to me, who was, quite frankly, hard-ass, big time.
I looked at her, and she understood me, but her eyes told me that it was better not to right then.
And I looked at her and she looked at me, and I didn't need to say anything because we both knew that I loved her, and I was sorry.
I mean, I came out of it eventually, but Jake... didn't look at me the same way again.
I don't care if you're the daughter of the President.
I looked into his eyes, and he looked into mine, and I just felt he had a great deal left to do with his life.
So I stayed with him until the man returned, but when I asked him about it, he looked at me like I was crazy, and when I turned around again, the little boy was gone.
But when I asked her... she looked at me like she didn't know what I was talking about.
Then mother opened her eyes and looked at me... as if she had known all along that I was staring at her... and asked if I thought her shoes were pretty.
He looked square at me but acted like he didn't know me, like he'd never seen me before.
For a couple of minutes, he stared at me and said:
And when we got to the school gate, I held your hands, and I looked into your eyes, and I said to you,
